data.title: Lonely letters
data.statement:
Given a [[sentence]] and <<n>> string(s) containing a character and a number separated by spac... WAIT, just talking about Thomas... he's maybe the guy you're going to hate the most for the next ten minutes...

Thomas who probably loves languages and crossword puzzles wants to output each character line by line (<<same chars still on the same line>>) to know exactly how the sentence is composed.

Thomas is also very careful and he doesn't want to miss a letter... he wants you to <<respect the position>> of each letter in the sentence by replacing the other letters by <<underscores>>.

Thomas that apparently is quite annoying and want you to waste your time, has also preferences for certain letters, so he gives you <<weight for each>> of them and he wants you to print each line respecting <<the weight in ascending order>>.

Example:
line 1: hello
line 2: 4
4 lines : "h 0", "e 5","l 15", "o 10"

Output:
'h____'
'_e___'
'___o'
'__ll_'

testCases.title: sentence
testCases.testIn:
hi, how are you ?
11
h 10
i 9
o 8
w 7
a 6
r 5
e 4
y 3
u 2
, 1
? 0

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
dhak ? dj,
7
d 2
h 6
a 5
k 4
? 3
j 1
, 0

testCases.title: Nonconsecutive numbers
testCases.testIn:
manic monday
8
i 55
d 33
c 210
m 9
y 2
o 17
a 100
n 84

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn:
wibbly wobbly
6
i 20
l 3
w 1007
o 15
y 666
b 91

data.constraints:
1 <= [[n]] <= 100
1 <= [[k]] <= 1000
each [[k]] is different
each [[c]] is different
data.stubGenerator:
read sentence:string(1024)
read n:int
loop n read line:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>> a string  [[sentence]]  
<<Line 2>> an integer [[n]]
<<n lines>> a string containing a character [[c]] and a number [[k]] separated by space
data.outputDescription: <<n lines>> each line showing one unique character of [[sentence]] with "_" replacing the others

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a sentence and n string(s) containing a character and a number separated by spac... WAIT, just talking about Thomas... he's maybe the guy you're going to hate the most for the next ten minutes...

Thomas who probably loves languages and crossword puzzles wants to output each character line by line (same chars still on the same line) to know exactly how the sentence is composed.

Thomas is also very careful and he doesn't want to miss a letter... he wants you to respect the position of each letter in the sentence by replacing the other letters by underscores.

Thomas that apparently is quite annoying and want you to waste your time, has also preferences for certain letters, so he gives you weight for each of them and he wants you to print each line respecting the weight in ascending order.

Example:
line 1: hello
line 2: 4
4 lines : "h 0", "e 5","l 15", "o 10"

Output:
'h____'
'_e___'
'___o'
'__ll_'
Input
Line 1 a string sentence
Line 2 an integer n
n lines a string containing a character c and a number k separated by space
Output
n lines each line showing one unique character of sentence with "_" replacing the others
Constraints
1 <= n <= 100
1 <= k <= 1000
each k is different
each c is different
Example
Input
aaaeee
2
a 1
e 0
Output
___eee
aaa___
